chunk.textFormat: On certain screws you have to tighten with a low torque using a torque wrench and ...
...after that tighten with the correct angle.

Two steps
Low torque
Angle tightening

Explain the difference between torque and angle tightening.
Show them how to do angle tightening.
Let the participants do the angle tightening.

A screw joint shall always be tightened with the correct torque according to the specification.
The pre-stress that is build up in the screw joint gives the clamping force. The clamping force gives the friction between two components, which holding them together
To give the screw joint reinforcement a determined pre stressing force it is possible to turn the screw/nut with a certain angle. This method gives a nearly absolute safety since the screw is tightened close to its own yield point.
Explain what happens if the screw is over tightened or too much angle tightening is applied.
Use the angle tightening to ensure that you get the correct clamping force without having to retighten later on.
